review_body: The hotel is in a good location and the building is new.However, the rooms are small for what you pay for and the curtains are bad, so if you are a light sleeper, you will be woken up earlyAlso, the hotel is above a shopping/restaurant complex, which closes at 11 pm. Which means that if you stay up past that time, you will have a hard time getting to your room! I had a verbal confrontation with the security guards late at night because I was just trying to get into my hotel room and they would not let me! Will never stay here again...

Reviews for Hotels need to be based on the type or let's say CLASS the hotel qualifies as. This Hotel is a 3 Star "Type ( Class?)" of Hotel , where as the Four Seasons, Waldorf etc., are 5 Star Type/Class of Hotels. People give a Holiday In Express 5 Stars and then the Waldorf Astoria gets a 5 Star.. um what the heck?  Shibuya Stream Excel Hotel Tokyu.. I give this 3 Star Class Hotel a 4 star review.• Pros. Location is great, Staff is accommodating, Room was clean, Bed/Pillows were great, the Concept of Amenities available on each floor is cool. One floor is the Kitchen/Food Meister has microwave, rice cooker and other similar, another floor is the Clothes (?) Meister- has pants iron, ironing boards, shoe polisher etc., another has ice, etc . Very nice looking hotel lobby and halls.• Cons. Our room was TINY! #1320 and we paid for the upgrade! -Tiny Room Fridge is really just to keep things 'cool' not cold. - TV 98% Japanese stations (Other Japan Hotels have ample English channels). - The Breakfast included was a BIG WASTE of time and money.... you choose from one of 4 choices which are each small portions.... i.e, french toast is 1/2 piece of bread cut in half again and 1/2 piece of bacon, watered down tomato juice, very few choices at their so called buffer area. - HARD TO FIND..this hotel is very hard to find... the address you give to a taxi driver is a huge building and area and this hotel is floors 9-13 and their lobby on the 4th floor.

Pros :- location is prima ! Next to the brand new mall (Shibuya Stream) and lots of Shibuya’s many ‘attractions’ (food, shopping, Shibuya crossing, Hachiko statue, etc).- Hotel is relatively new.- Room : super clean and cozy. Great amenities.- Bedsets (pillow, duvet, sheets) : one of the best beds & pillows we have ever slept in. Wanted to buy the pillow, but they don’t sell it :(- Breakfast : very good, Japanese style with modern touch, very satisfying.- Torrent Restaurant : great New Year’s eve dinner ! Desserts are fabulous.- Robot ‘hotel attendant’ : very amusing and efficient ! It replaces human for doing small & easy tasks.- Taxi service to the nearest sister hotel (Cerulean Tower Tokyu Hotel) to reach airport bus was great. Super convenient & super clean taxi !Cons :- Room size : moderately small, but still acceptable, considering this is Tokyo.

Had 7 nights here after skiing, location is superb and fitout is great but the beds are the worst we’ve ever experienced. It was like sleeping on a concrete slab, my wife and I woke every morning feeling stiff and extremely sore, to the point we’ve booked in our chiropractor when we got home! The couch in the main lobby was more comfortable. We asked about the beds on our first night and there was an attitude of don’t care and there is no solution. Also weirdly, there is no towel rails in the bathrooms.If you need a softer bed then I can not recommend this hotel - shame as it has so potential

I stayed in this hotel for close to 10 days. The hotel is located in the middle of the busiest streets of Tokyo.Well connected by metro lines, the hotel compound also has 200+ restaurants making the stay complete in itself. The staff is friendly and the rooms have all the amenities needed for a good stay. Few things that can be improved:- In-room dining options can be provided for business travelers who are tired to go out; especially since it gets quite cold outside- vegetarian and vegan menus since the people who come and stay are global travelers- Keeping a microwave and some plates in the room for in-room eating- There was a kitchen on the 13th floor but there were no cooking utensils or guides to use the devices. This made the kitchen unusable for travelers like me. I tried asking the staff who was cleaning there but she did not understand English. - Pick and drop from an airport limousine drop point that can be charged.

I searched for a hotel room for two adults and one 5-year-old child through Hotels.com, using this occupancy information as the search criterion. This hotel seemed to fit the bill so I booked it. Imagine our surprise when, upon entering our room, we found that there was a queen-sized bed... and nothing else. A visit to the reception revealed that there are no rollaway beds/sofabeds or even floor mattresses available at this hotel. Not a single one."Where is my child supposed to sleep?"The receptionist shrugs. Don't know, don't care."Why are you advertising this room for 'up to 3 people' when that is obviously not truthful?"Another shrug.Further discussion revealed that they DID, in fact, have a room available that could fit an extra bed - for more than twice the price.(Now, if this hotel had any sense of customer service, they would've said "Sorry, we messed up, please allow us to move you to a room that matches what you actually booked"... but evidently that's not how this hotel rolls.)At this point it was long past my child's bedtime so, begrudgingly, we paid the difference and received the key to the bigger corner room.Imagine our surprise (again!) when we entered the new, bigger room and there was still no extra bed! There was only a narrow, short, extremely hard chaise-longue whose shape did not allow for any practical addition of bedlinen. Speaking of which, there was none. Another call to the reception and they delivered us one (1) flat sheet and one (1) very scratchy woollen blanket. No pillow, no blanket cover. We make do the best we can with what we've got. Every morning the housekeeping un-made the sorry excuse of a bed back into a chaise-longue. We had to keep re-making it over and over again. None of us got much rest during our stay in Tokyo and we were glad to leave at the end.Families: THIS HOTEL DOES NOT WANT YOUR CUSTOM. I'd strongly advise you to stay away.The attitude of the staff makes it impossible for me to recommend this hotel to anyone, with children or not.

We loved Shibuya Stream Excel! First and foremost you cannot beat the location! It’s literally on top of the metro station, in the middle of Tokyo. The hotel is spotless, and the staff was so incredibly helpful, which went out if their way to assist us. I asked about the toll highways and moments later a letter with detailed directions, calculated toll fees to our destination, including a personal bakery recommendation arrived. We regretted staying in another hotel in Shinjuku a few days later. The hotel’s laundry room (equipped with washers pre-loaded with soap and softener) is an awesome amenity for those that like to pack light. We got Starbucks in the morning, which is in the same complex, avoiding the overpriced breakfast they offer there. There’s a ton of restaurants within the complex as well as a high end mall. We can’t wait to visit soon again!

First of all, the room was much smaller than first time around (even though it was in same price category and bed is the same size) and it was on a different side of the hotel so this time had a lot of street noise especially from the major train station downstairs. This made the ridiculous ceiling lamp, which you can’t help but hit your head on repeatedly even more of a nuisance (form over function for sure!)Secondly, when booking found the price varied wildly from night to night: as much as several hundred dollars difference dollars for a single, even though I was booking months in advance. So I wasn’t able to string as many nights together here as I would’ve liked, and had to split up my stay with another hotel (which was good, and so will probably stay in that one place next time instead of here).The staff was friendly, as usual. Just a few strange things that made the stay less enjoyable... First of all, I made the mistake of trying to do laundry this time around. They have one coin washer/dryer FOR THE ENTIRE HOTEL!!!!! Then, instead of having an iron and ironing board in the room as many Japanese hotels do, or a trouser press at least (as almost all Japanese hotels do), they direct you to their “meister” floor, which has to be one of the most idiotic ideas ever: it has 2 irons, again to be shared by THE ENTIRE HOTEL. And if you choose to use the trouser presses here, you’ve got to just wait around; one of the great conveniences to having a trouser press in your room is you can do other things and then voila your pants are pressed. They have other “meister” floors too, like a “drink meister” floor with vending machine, which really means they only have one vending machine for drinks again, IN THE ENTIRE HOTEL. I began to realize this “meister” concept, which they promote a lot, is really just a way for them to cut corners. On the plus side, there is a 7-11 outside on the ground floor, and an absolutely fabulous grilled fish restaurant on one of the restaurant floors (outside the hotel but inside the same mixed-use building). Lunch here is particularly reasonable and it’s food that’s not easy to get outside Japan.

Stayed for 3 nights at the end of a 2 week trip around Japan and this was just fabulous. The rooms are a very good size and the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom amenities are a little odd, given that the shower and bath basically are a wet room but they were clean. Staff were helpful, the lobby is stylish, bar is nice to start an evening and it's very well located to lots of restaurants, Shibuya train station and crosswalk. Would absolutely stay here again.

I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and it’s one of the best during my trip! The design of the room is modern and spacious. Love the design of the long sofa in the room and it was comfortable. The bed, omg! The quality of the pillows and blankets were so good and the bed was so comfy that it put all my hotel stays before that during this trip to shame. They also provided decent and sufficient amenity kit. My husband complained that the shaving cream/gel and the shaver were not working that well though.The location was great since it’s located within a mall with variety of food and drinks, and it’s near the train station. I love the ideas of the “Meister Rooms”. They look clean and modern and are very useful. I’m not sure if 1 washer and 1 dryer in the Style Meister is enough. It was being used when I first saw it, so I had to wait for awhile until the washer is vacant.However, the variety of the mains for breakfast is quite limited. 2 breakfasts in the hotel is ok, 3 is probably too much. I wouldn’t get the breakfast option if i were to stay there again.

So this hotel is very nice from the outside. The staff is wonderful and super helpful HOWEVER very strange vibes. I left my room for lunch and within an hour someone came in my room and manged to put all my towels on the floor without cleaning anything else. There was water on the floor of the shower but no sign of cleaning. The sheets had been pulled back to their original position but the bed was not made and trash remained. Also how you have a toilet room without a dimmer is beyond me. I haven't slept in 3 nights because when I go to the restroom at 2 in the morning I'm woken up by a freaking spotlight that AUTOMATICALLY turns on. For a hotel this nice, you would think they have soundproofing from street noise. No. I've been awoken by sirens every night. The temperature is a whole different challenge. Again for a hotel this nice you'd think they have central air but there's an AC unit in my room that I swear only has a high setting, it stays a freezing 60 degrees even though it's set to "72". Bidets are nice, oh and breakfast is good. Again staff that I've interacted with have been nice but this is a joke. If my company weren't paying for this I'd move hotels.

This hotel has a Manhattan Loft feel. The rooms are well proportioned and very comfortable, it has a western size bed and a walk in shower. Below are lots of restaurants to choose from and it has a walk way to the metro. Staff were efficient and friendly and they have a robot to deliver room service! . Perfect for business or holiday. Our room was at the front of the hotel and you could here noise from the traffic (13th floor) so a room round the back might be better.

We loved this hotel! We stayed here for 4 nights. It was in such a great location! It was clean, comfortable, the room is spacious, the staff spoke English, and were so kind. CJ at the hotel bar is incredible! The cocktails were great that he would make. The train station is steps away and so is the infamous Shibuya crossing! There are many shops and places to eat right downstairs from your hotel. It is a newer hotel but we had such a wonderful stay!

Absolutely lovely stay. Very good location and friendly helpful staff. Hotel was very comfortable and clean. Will definitely be back. Good eating complex downstairs. Happy hour in hotel was worthwhile and good tv in bar to watch rugby World Cup.

This is a new hotel boasting beautiful rooms, with panoramic views, and in a great location. There are many restaurants and amenities either on-site or very nearby and it is also easily accessible to many other parts of Tokyo.
user_name:
Nancy S
New York City, New York

review_body: As most reviews state, the location is perfect if you want a central point to navigate around Tokyo.The hotel is clean, modern and spacious. Plenty of restaurants downs in the mall.Staff very hospitable and friendly . Great hotel.

Plus:- Easy check in- Very clean rooms- Modern design- Very good location- Modern facility- With establishments in the building- Nice robot delivers your room orders- Beside Train station- 5 min walk to Shibuya CrossingMinus:- no buffet breakfast- limited breakfast food options

This stylish, new hotel was a happy find. Our standard room was well renovated and felt spacious. There is a distance to walk to Shibuya station but it was manageable. What was outstanding was the service of the Japanese reception staff who helped us during the checkout process, making us feel like valued guests.

Firstly, it’s not an easy hotel to find and don’t get confused with Shibuya Excel hotel which is on the other side of the road.Conveniently located on the 2nd floor next to Shibuya subway station but not easy to find as the station has lots of exits. Follow signs to Shibuya Scramble. You’ll find the lifts to the hotel lobby just a few doors after Dean & Deluca. Loved the location of Stream Excel hotel! A short 10mins walk to Hachiko statue and Shibuya crossing as well as many food outlets, cafes and shops. Keep on walking 25-30mins you can reach Omotesando and Harajuka. Take the subway from Shibuya station to anywhere ! Easy and convenient. Just very crowded ! We had a room on the top floor with a great view is the street below. Room is very clean, comfortable, compact and well designed . Good use of the small space. Highly recommend Shibuya Stream Excel for first time travelers to Tokyo

This was our first Japan trip, and my partner and I were extremely happy with this hotel as our Tokyo base (we stayed twice during our trip).Location: Perfect. The hotel is right next to Shibuya Station, close to the Yamanote line which rings the city. Tokyo changes so quickly that, on our second stay a week later, the nearby Shibuya Scramble Square building had just opened, which now provides even more convenient access to the hotel - via escalator, elevator and covered walkway (<5 minutes to get to the Yamanote platform from the room)! The hotel also has a huge range of casual and fancy restaurants on the floors beneath it, and is close to the main Shibuya tourist sights.Room: Generous for Japan standards (but cosy for Westerners!), and extremely clean. Despite temporary roadwork underneath the hotel, it was quiet. Rooms have great views of the city - making for great time-lapse videos of the cars and commuters below! Block-out curtains allowed for sleeping in. The bathroom featured separate modern toilet and shower+bath. The bathroom sink was in the main room, and was well stocked with toiletries. There is a USB port for charging phones on the bedside table, and plenty of power points to charge devices. Each room has a dehumidifier/air-purifier, and is stocked with free water bottles each day.Food: Breakfast was included and was offered until 1000 (latest arrival 0930). We were offered a choice of french toast, omelette, fried eggs or eggs benedict; then we could help ourselves to a decent Western+Japanese buffet table (including muesli, yoghurt, salads, breads and pastries, and drinks). The bar and restaurants on the lobby level were also good. There is a room service robot which can deliver a range of snacks to your room - we highly recommend trying this as a novelty!Facilities: The hotel has complementary very fast free Wi-Fi throughout. The 'Style Care Meister' on Level 11 has excellent washing (400yen), drying (100yen) and ironing (free) facilities.Service: Extremely good service from all staff, all of whom spoke fluent English. They have self-service check-in/out kiosks, too. They were happy to store our bags for a whole day after we had checked out.We will definitely stay here again on our next holiday to Tokyo!

Kind of a newly branded stylish hotel under the Tokyu Excel Group. We were used to staying in Excel Shibuya next to the station for its spacious room and convenient location, and were seeing this new hotel may be a good alternative when Excel was becoming old.Undoubtedly, this hotel is much newer and the interior is much more trendy and stylish that would delight you. However, it was much smaller than the old Excel, and it was more sized like the other typical Tokyo hotels.

We stayed here for a week at the start of our trip to Japan. It is in a great location, directly above Shibuya station for JR trains and the subway. We found it easy to get from Haneda airport and to the major attractions in the city. It is also within walking distance of great bars and restaurants in Shibuya and Harajuku. The hotel is new, well decorated and comfortable with good-sized rooms which are well cleaned. The staff are friendly and polite.The only negatives were noise from outside the hotel - we were woken during the night several times by sirens and I would have expected a new hotel would have better soundproofing. Similarly, the air conditioning control panel emitted a very bright green light throughout the night that couldn’t be turned off without turning off the A/C.Shibuya station is very complex and visitors should head for the Central Gate and exit 16 - NOT the New South Gate (as we did several times) which is a long walk further away. Once the construction work around the station is complete, it will be a lot easier to walk around outside the hotel.

Staying 5 nights with a standard double room. The location is fine. It is easy to be access from the metro . About 5 mins walk from the nearest metro exit. However there are several construction in progress close to the station area , the walkable distance had increased from the some of the metro exit. The hotel lobby is spacious and well decorated . The staffs are polite and the efficient while checking in. The room is clean , neat and tidy . The interior design is pretty nice, a small sitting area is provided. Restaurants are just downstairs. Have tried the lobster roll. Delicious . Recommended

We absolutely loved our stay at the new Shibuya Stream Excel Hotel Tokyu. I am glad I booked this hotel during our vacation in Tokyo. Room - stayed at a corner room and it was quite spacious. Great views from 2 sides of the room. The beds were comfortable. I liked the modern design and furnishings. Air conditioning/temperature just right. It has all the requisites coffee machine, pot, ref. Housekeeping was excellent and room cleaned thoroughly every day. Bathroom - shower and toilet facilities were amazing! Separate rooms for both which was very convenient. The modern Japanese toilet deserves 5 stars. Toiletries are complete and replaced daily. Hotel facilities & Service - the meisters in the different floors are a nice touch. Hotel staff also helpful and fluent in English. Breakfast- ok variety for breakfast. Not as much as in 5 star hotels but still satisfying. Location - hotel sits in the brand new Shibuya stream building with a modern mall filled with many dining options. It has direct access to the train stations also. It is a 10 min walk or so to the crossing. Not as near as the other excel hotel but not very far either. Hope to stay here again in the future.

It is a nice trendy hotel. Room is pretty big. Nice hotel bar they have. The location is kind a confusing and far from train system... just pretty confusing... the mall connected to it is pretty cool and have good selections of food. Not a big fan of their breakfast. Its actually pretty bad. Room is good size. If i choose again i wont stay in this hotel again. Just not my style.

Hotel is well situated in Shibuya - couple minutes walk from train station. Also convenient relations with Cerulean hotel to connect with free taxi fro limousine bus to airport. Room very modern, stylish, full amenities. Helpful staff.

Anyone who’s been will understand when I say this: Shibuya is insane. For maximum sensory overload (and convenience) there’s a well-known four-star Excel Hotel Tokyu right in the middle of the action—but there’s also a sister property a safe distance away. This is where my girlfriend and I stayed this past April, at the three-star Shibuya Stream Excel Hotel Tokyu.LocationIf you’re taking the NEX in from Narita then getting to the Stream is fairly straightforward; the hotel is a short block from the Shibuya Station New South Exit. But if you’re arriving via Haneda (like we were) then your best route to the hotel requires a Limousine Bus to the Cerulean, then a transfer to a free taxi for the rest of the way, compliments of the Tokyu Hotels group.Once you’re checked in you’ll want to familiarize yourself with the underground path to Shibuya station proper. It’s more than a bit daunting with a sea of people walking in either direction down there, but once you figure it out you can walk to the Hachiko Exit in less then ten minutes.There’s also lots of decent restaurants closer to the hotel, along with a generally more relaxed vibe than the other side of the highway.RoomWe booked a Standard Double and were assigned to Room #1329. Though a bit on the small side it was very smartly laid out, except for the bed. Hoteliers take note: pushing a bed up against a wall is cruel and unusual punishment for your guests.The bathroom was split into three separate areas, with the sink and vanity mirror in the main room. The very modern Japanese washlet was tucked away behind a separate door, as was the wet room with a shower and tub. For a couple sharing their morning routines this worked out great.BreakfastBreakfast downstairs was a modest affair but got the job done. The buffet table offered salad, soup, fruit, yogurt, bread, cereal and pastries. Coffee, tea and juices could be dispensed at separate stations. Curiously, the teas were only available via coffee-style pods.In addition to the buffet diners could also order a hot entrée direct from the kitchen. The two options during our stay were eggs benedict and french toast; this proud Canadian went with the latter and had no complaints—even with the bizarre orange sauce option, which was actually quite tasty.VerdictThough I must deduct points for the bed up against the wall (you monsters) I would still recommend the Shibuya Stream for any visitor to Tokyo who wants to be near the action, but not right in the middle of it.

great location near shibuya station, yet there is a construction site nearby and you have to en route when heading to the hotel from the station, quite inconvenient when carrying bulky luggage. The room is new, hip and spacious.coin laundry available but only one washing machine, unfriendly design and time consuming. We were given a room at the far end of the corridor, take a long walk from elevator hall, stupid floor plan layout. Overall not a very pleasant experience.

It's close to the Shibuya station, although it's not as close as the original Excel Hotel. At the first, it's a bit hard to find, but once you know it, it's not bad. Probably because of the location in Tokyo, it's quite expensive. We paid $250 per person each nigh. The front desk people were all very pleasant and helpful. The room was clean and nice, although the lighting system was confusing. The room has a shower room and toilet room separately, and not next to each other, which was a bit inconvenient. The buffet breakfast was OK.They two choices for the main course. Neither was healthy and the French toast was so soggy. The bread selection was bad. Very thin white bread and croissants and danish pastries. No healthy bread.

Like a lot of people we arrived by NEX from Narita, take the "New South Exit" and turn left as you exit. About 100m there is an escalator to take you into the new complex.Find a lift and it will open up into the reception.A very new building and hotel with bigger than average Tokyo rooms means that you will have a very relaxing stay.We were only there for 3 nights but found the place to be excellent. Since you are in Shibuya you have easy access to so many areas by foot, if you want to take the trains/subway its easy too, the building is part of the massive station.Try the delivery robot, it's hilarious :D

We booked two rooms at this hotel for 5 days... as we were traveling with young children we had requested for an early check in which they helped us with. Location is super and the rooms are super comfy. The station is hardly any distant.. only draw back was the breakfast ... very few choices and staff was not really bothered ... Also no in room dining

Very satisfied and very fortunate for me and family to have stayed at this hotel, in fact we stayed twice during June at this hotel. The location of this hotel is close to shibuya station. Lots of restaurants and cafes located on the second floor of this hotel and also there is a 7 eleven mini market located on the first floor of the hotel. Guest laundry and dryer are also available on the 11th floor. Small gym are also available though i never use it during my stay.Room size depends on the type. As we had 2 rooms with different types, i would recommend for a corner room as it is spacious for a Japan’s standard, however, the size of the standard room is not too bad for the local standard.For all the good things that I felt about the hotel’s environment, it wouldn’t be completed without the service I’ve received from the hotel’s staffs.This is the area I felt they are doing really well, in fact, it is the best I’ve encountered whilst in Japan. My first stay, on the 8th of June, for 3 nights, it was all smooth from check in time till check out.My second stay, which was on the 13th of June, was the time i really felt all those names I mentioned above (Nilu , Wada and R. Tsukamoto) went above their beyond of duties to help me and my family.My reservation got cancelled by accident (I do not know who cancelled this reservation) and I realized it at the time I was about to check in. Normally, when the hotel is running a very high occupancy rate, they would have offered you a room with their publish rate, but not for the front desk staffs at this hotel. They are willingly trying to communicate to their superior to get me my booking back and guess what, after a while, I got my room exactly the same type as i booked it and with the same price as i had previously. Thank you to you all for the amazing service you gave me and my family and yes, those dolls you gave for my kids, they brought it with them to sleep.Thank you Thank you very much!!!!

It was a gamble when we decided to try out this brand new hotel. And the gamble paid off! Because of Tokyo 2020, the whole Shibuya Stream was made very accessible via both underground passageways and aboveground skywalks to and from the Shibuya Station (JR line and Tokyo metro lines). Very convenient and straightforward. Just take exit 16 and you're at the hotel building.The size of the room we had was very very very good given that Tokyo hotel rooms are really tiny. This came with a small living space next to the windows and the bathroom was huge by Tokyo standards! Very thoughtful amenity kits were also provided. Cleaning was great throughout our one week stay.One small area of improvement would be front desk staff. Everytime I communicated with them, regardless of whether it is to help with making restaurant reservations or to ask them to fix the broken minibar fridge in our room, the staff didn't seem too keen. In fact, it's often less than the regular Japanese standard of service. Quite disappointing sometimes really.There were many choice places for food within the building like a Luke's lobster roll kiosk as well as Starbucks. Many eateries within 2 mins of it. Very convenient. Overall, we really enjoyed the stay at Shibuya Stream Excel Tokyu. It was an excellent location and had very generous sized rooms for the price we paid.

Best hotel ever!!The room is perfect clean and cozyAll services are excellentThe room has slippers pajamas nice smell towels and shower rope hangersThe hotel has a small exercising area it’s not a real gymThe reception are so friendly as wellThe breakfast wasn’t divert but it was delicious The smell of the hotel is greatPlus it’s close to the station There plenty of restaurants on the ground floor

The hotel is very new and has a great design.The room I had was relatively spacious by Tokyo standards with a great bathroom area... Separate toilet... Separate shower and bath.Room is well designed and quiet given the super central location.My little quirks...WiFi was terrible. For such a new hotel it's surprising. I was there on business and had to do some conference calls and the WiFi could not hold the connection.The bed is super firm. I know is Asia and I don't mind a firm mattress but I found this too hard.The curtains are poor at blocking out light. I like a really dark room... This is dark but not completely black out.

The hotel is nice and new, the rooms are quite spaceous by Tokyo's standards and are styled quite nicely. A bit more shelf space would be nice, as well as extra hooks for towels. WiFi is horrendous, at least on the 11th floor. Every single of our devices either cannot connect, or cannot maintain connection for more than 30 seconds without either losing internet connectivity or being disconnected entirely. Really not good after paying $500 AUD for a night.

A near new hotel in an extremely convenient location, especially if you need to travel to or from Narita airport, since the hotel is only a few minutes walk from Shibuya Station and the bustling Shibuya shopping and entertainment district.The staff were unfailingly polite and helpful, the room compact but not excessively so, and the breakfast buffet (if you're inclined to spend ~$30 p.p.) is excellent.There is a bar/entertainment area near reception, and plenty of eating options close to the hotel, including several representing different cuisines adjacent to the hotel lift (the hotel is several storeys above ground level).Recommended!

My family have stayed there for 2 nights. They provides sufficient car parking space for guests. If you are going to shop around in Shibuya, it is one of the most convenient hotels as just 10 minutes walk to all the famous malls around there. Their hygiene at room is good and the facilities are still in very new status. Their room is relatively big which is one of the reasons we picked it.

We absolutely loved our stay here. It was our first time in Japan and was blown away by how central this location was once we got our bearings. Literally minutes from Shibuya Station + the scramble. Right below the hotel is two levels are brand new and AMAZING restaurants and a small specialty convenience store. Perfect for morning coffee or a quick bite. The hotel itself is trendy and has great decor. We loved our room and its view. VERY clean and modern . Staff was helpful and pleasant. Highly recommend.

We enjoyed this hotel. The rooms were comfortable and immaculate.the hotel provided a cell phone to use while a guest. We programmed it with google maps. The hotel is located above a lot of restaurants and coffee shops, many of which are open late. The subway is in walking distance, probably about .3 miles. And there’s a coin operated laundry. On the other hand, climate control was a problem the first night. The second night I just set it much lower than I would have at home. Our package had breakfast included. Breakfast every day was either eggs Benedict or a rather odd French toast. There was also a side buffet with nice western options, so I skipped the main offering after the first day.

Superb! With great service, friendly staff, modern design, this hotel highly impressed us. The rooms are big enough to open the suitcases and the location of the hotel is perfect to explore Tokyo and especially Shibuya. We'll definitely be back.

Great location for sight seeing, you can easily walk to many fun areas like Harajuku. Excellent staff - very helpful. They don’t all speak English, but there was always someone on staff that did. Great room - quiet, great bed, nicely laid out, clean, modern but cozy too. They’re are lots of options to eat close by too from sushi to amazing hamburgers! Loved this hotel!!

Stayed in Shibuya Stream Excel twice during our recent trip to Japan. Great modern, clean hotel within a stones throw from Shibuya station; making it a so handy for getting connections to the rest of the city. Stayed in Standard Double room both times. Some have complained about the size but found in more enough. Very comfortable and great views. Great stay both times and would recommend.

My wife and I kicked off our Japan trip here with 4 nights in this lovely hotel in Shibuya. Perfect location with perfect accessibility to Shibuya Station. Staff was so helpful and friendly. Restaurant for breakfast was delightful. The room had a great view of Tokyo and was clean and comfy. Would totally stay here again!

Couldn’t be happier with this hotel.We got a base double room and although not ,massive in size, clever design makes it feel large and well developed. All the modern appliances plus air humidifier, great toiletries bag, Surrounded by shops and food options the hotel is beautifully designed. Especially loved the option of having a robot deliver items to our room, like a power adaptor.Very very good

This was without question the best of the 7 hotels I stayed in during my trip around Japan. Located close to Shibuya, you are only a few steps away from countless bars and restaurants. The hotel lobby is based on the 4th floor, with the 3 below full of places to eat and drink too. Very clean with good sized rooms with good views. The hotel bar is nice and has a happy hour between 5 and 7 every day which is useful. Would stay again without doubt.

Very nice, brand new hotel. Convenient to the Shibuya station and even more convenient to the outbound Narita Express to the airport. The room was very nice, spacious and clean with a decent view.The only thing about the hotel was that there really aren't any amenities. They say they have a fitness center, which is only 2 spin bikes, a ball and a mat.It is in a BRAND new facility with lots of restaurant options on the property.At the time of our stay (May 2019) there is a lot of construction happening around the Shibuya station that includes access to this property, so it is difficult to get from the Shibuya station to the hotel at the moment. Not the hotel's fault, but it won't be very convenient for I would say a year. Very nice staff, very nice hotel. I would stay here again.

Great hotel to stay at in Tokyo. Very convenient location, near Shibuya Station (for trains and subway). Modern and clean rooms, great restaurant, nice bar. Staff was very friendly and requested early check-in was possible.

An excellent option for a mid-to high level hotel in Shibuya. There are some issues right now with access around the station but this hasn't affected the hotel itself. The new Stream Mall has a plethora of dining and entertainment options. The hotel is raised above the fray of the Shibuya transfer area on a podium of a design that will be familiar to travelers in modern Asia. Fit-outs are brand new and the hotel occupancy appears to be below peak levels. It's likely that some are dissuaded by being on the wrong side of the station from Shibuya's main sites and the ongoing construction detours. This fear is unfounded. There are good conveniences and the hotel is well sited for someone exploring Shibuya as well as Ebisu. The rooms are a modern and stylish design and quite spacious for Tokyo. All rooms seem to have decent views. Taxi drivers generally won't know where this place is but hopefully that will change with time. Once construction and soft-opening is done with expect prices to rise quickly.

The hotel is modern and clean. The room is smallish but what is expected in Japan. The location is great, right next to the Shibuya Train station. From here you can go anywhere in Tokyo. The station is huge so it is important to take note of which exit to use when coming back to hotel. The staff at the hotel had limited English. There is no tour desk there but they have a brochure for a Tourist Agency, Wander Compass, which is located in the station. This agency is well worth a visit. They can look after all your tourist needs. We didn't eat in the hotel. There are three floors of restaurants and eateries below the hotel which allows for lots of choices. Note- some restaurants do not have any English speaking staff which makes things a bit tricky. The hotel also has a laundry which was very convenient as we had come off a 14 day cruise. We also found it very easy to catch a train from near the cruise terminal in Yokohama to the Shibuya Station. We bought Suica cards in Aust as well so no need to buy train tickets, just tap and go - well worth looking into (can be used for vending machines as well and easy to top up). Overall a good hotel.

This is a stylish hotel that seems like a boutique because it only takes up a few floors in a multi-purpose building, but each floor is quite large so I think the hotel is bigger than it seems.Location is great; will be even better when all the construction around Shibuya Station is completed. Right now best access is from “Shin-Minami” JR Exit which is good for Saikyo, Rinkan, Shonan-Shinjuku, and Narita Express lines, but not for the ubiquitous Yamanote Line. On the other side of the hotel there’s easy access to Tokyu Toyoko Line and subway Hanzomon Line, but not the ubiquitous Ginza Line. (That’ll change when construction is finished, but for now give yourself 15 extra minutes).Hotel is virtually brand new and although rooms aren’t huge, single rooms have decent sized beds and leather sofas. Beds have pillow-tops and are comfortable. There’s a reasonable amount of space around the sink for toiletries.There are many excellent restaurants in the building outside of the hotel (I did not eat @ the hotel). I especially enjoyed one specializing in grilled fish. There is a 7-11 downstairs.The only real huge mistake in design was a low hanging lamp in the middle of the room that seemed to be there just for the purpose of hitting my head on it a million times. Several other things in the room seemed a bit too compact: a refrigerator about 1/2 the normal “Japan hotel” size, and an in room safe also about 1/2 the normal size (could not fit my very small laptop.) The room could’ve used a full-length or at least bigger mirror somewhere other than the sink. And there is no bath, only shower at least in single room.I also didn’t like how they made me pay (using automated machine) when I checked in, which unnecessarily made check-in a two-step process since an actual person handled the paperwork part. That was clunky. I had to use that machine again to check out, why not charge me then? (They already has my credit card from when I made the reservation.) With that said, the front desk staff was friendly and good.View from the room was tremendous. At a more expensive price I’d question my unquestioning devotion to this hotel right now. I even hesitated to write my review because I don’t want it to become so popular that the price will go up a lot! But as long as it stays at similar price point, this will now be the first place I will look for the next time I come to Tokyo (usually about once every six months).

We were really pleased with the Shibuya Stream hotel. 6 month old hotel. Modern. Clean. Included free breakfast. In heart of Shibuya and near so many great neighborhoods. Omotesando. Daikanyama. Naka-Meguro. Ebisu. Roppongi Hills. What we love about Tokyo is the contradiction of the neon and big buildings (Shibuya) and the small, quant neighborhoods with small winding streets, cool shops and cafes. Shibuya stream is in the heart of the glitz but 15-30 minute walk to all these amazing neighborhoods. We tended to find dinner in the neighborhoods and our teenage girls loved the shopping in Shibuya and the hip show off the beaten path. The hotel is near every train line so great location to get around Tokyo. We got two rooms next to each other which was great. The price was definitely better than other options. Great hotel. Great location. Good price. This is a really nice, high end four star hotel.

(+) The view from the room was stunning (Tokyo Tower In the background). The location was very convenient right next to the Shibuy Station. Restaurants and bars choices in the same building (Shibuya Stream). Having a mobile phone in the room that guests could use was also a nice gesture, we didn’t use it since we’ve already had everything arranged beforehand. Room was spacious enough. (-) The low hanging lamp right next to the bed was simply unwise and dangerous. If you don’t pay attention, you’d hit your head every time you use the table next to the window. No sink in the toilet and no wall hooks in the shower for towels. No storage space except one drawer that was half occupied by a safe. I had to put my suitcase in the toilet. The sink is actually in a hall corner between the bathroom and the toilet with limited space for personal stuff. Lots of waste: every day we got new slippers for no particular reason, breakfast tickets were printed on paper for each day per person (why not just use the key or room number?). Breakfast was disappointing with inadequate portions and limited choices. I particularly didn’t like the cook touching my food with his bare fingers and sending it back to me after I sent it back to the kitchen because it wasn’t what I ordered.

We took the chance to book this hotel before it opened and very happy we did. It is in a new complex with restaurants and train stations right below the hotel, and great location for shopping, other restaurants and famous Shibuya district. The hotel room was stylish, modern with great views. Perfect for holiday in Tokyo and would stay here again next time in Tokyo.

The hotell is situated close to the Narita-express and the subway station of Shibuya in a multi purpose building with restaurants, café and offices. The hotell is clean and the rooms just right. We loved the Japanese deep bathtubs. The reception is on the 4th floor of the building so locate a lift to take you there. The rooms are then higher in the building. We would recommend this hotell due to it´s location especially for those visiting the area for the first time.

Pros: location and proximity to Shibuya was excellent - as others have said, take the New South exit from the Narita Express, turn left and walk up the street to find the hotel. From the JR underground, look for exit 16b (yellow exit signs) which take you to the bottom of the hotel. Reception is on the 4th floor above all the eateries. Beautiful room and decor. Great amenities. Easy check in and out. The views are amazing, even from the 9th floor which is the start of the accommodation levels. The rooms are nice and quiet. Cons: the layout doesn’t work. I booked the standard double (24sqm). The bed was pushed against the wall in order to squeeze in a freestanding desk and chair with pendant light. As a couple, it means one person has to crawl to the end of the bed to get out. And the amount of times we hit our heads on the pendant light!!!Having the basin outside the bathroom takes up valuable space and the hall area contained a decorative stand that was too small for luggage, which was a waste of space. There is nowhere to store luggage. I’ve previously stayed at the royal park hotel in Shiodome, in a room that was only 1 sqm larger, yet it felt huge in comparison because of the smarter layout.

Stayed here last month for 5 nights with my wife and was very impressed. Looks brand new, helpful staff with decent English, a location within a short walk of Shibuya station and awesome views from the room (could see the Tokyo Tower which was cool lit up at night).Only thing I can find fault with is that the breakfast was mediocre with not much choice, but not a big deal given how great everything else is.Plus it even has a robot that brings you bottles of mineral water to your room for free! Ring down to the front desk and ask for it and it comes to your door and back down again by the lifts :) I'm a big child so loved it.

Room is spacious, clean and modern. Staff are friendly and accommodating during the stay. Station is very near that connects to other lines. Shops are close. overall, more than happy throughout the stay

The staff, from the reception to the cleaners to the breakfast, is super nice and friendly and goes out of its way to accomodate guests. We kindly asked for a check-in at 1pm which worked out. They also have a phone in your room for you to borrow (it has internet on it) for when you go walk around in the city. We didn’t use it but it’s nice that they offer it.We had booked via Agoda, several months in advance, and got a very good rate incl. breakfast.The room (standard) was super clean, fairly spacious. The breakfast was yummy! There’s a delicious buffet with fresh honey, various cheeses, yoghurt, scrambled egg, fresh fruits, avocado/shrimp/potato salad, quality bread, and a bunch of other fantastic things. You also get to order either a special egg dish or french toast dish, which is also included.This hotel can be reached from the international airport with the Narita Express (80 minutes or so). Shibuya is the biggest and most complicated station and intersection with dozens of exits and resembling crossroads. So; here’s a tip - when you get out of the Narita Express, immediately look for “New South Exit”. Once outside, look to your left and walk that way for 1 minute: Shibuya Stream (also a mall with restaurant) is there, the hotel is on the 4th floor! You can’t miss it!

We booked this hotel for 1 night close to Christmas due to the location above the train station. Very handy when you want to explore a bit of Shibuya on limited time. Although there was cheaper around we paid about $240 AUS for 1 night and I didn't think this was unreasonable.The hotel was clean, room spacious, wifi good & fantastic breakfast. Would consider staying here again in the future.

Check in service was cold; room is subpar in size; hotel is overrated for the price- should have been half of what was paid. Will not return, even if we wanted to, we wouldn't be able to find the entrance (nor could the taxi driver find it). Careful: there's a hotel nearby with an extremely similar name. On the upside, quick service, nice lobby but misleading.

Stay for the location, NOT the service. Rude staff. Bad service model throughout. Length of stay: 6 days, 5 night. 12/20/18 to 12/25/18Service at the Shibuya Stream Excel Hotel Tokyu is appalling. There is a distinct lack of warmth and graciousness. Granted, the hotel has only been open for 3 months so this might be a matter of finessing their service model, but what we experienced points to one that is not customer-centric. Here are a few examples:1. After much appealing, they allowed us a late checkout time of 11:30 am; a full 30 minutes extra. He king out past that will incur a fee of about $100. At 11 am, we got a call from the front desk asking us to leave the room immediately! They are not accommodating, eager or even happy to make your stay more pleasant. 2. Seating for the breakfast buffet is baffling. There is an older gentleman who seats you. He is surly and rather stern. He will not seat a single person at a two-person table near the window. Go figure. 3. Perhaps it’s simply a lack of training, but no one at the front desk knows how to troubleshoot the hotel’s complimentary phone. Instead of trying to help you, they will simply tell you it can’t be done. Here are a few tips to make your stay bearable:1. The corner rooms are much larger. If you can, spring for this room type. 2. Don’t bother buying the hotel breakfast. It is a poor excuse of a buffet. No standard fare such as eggs, bacon or potatoes. Instead there is an assortment of breads, pickled herring, mushrooms, rice balls, salad leaves and yoghurt. 3. There is a deli on the second floor of the building (hotel lobby is on 4th). The food is reasonably priced and delicious to boot. There is also. Starbucks on the other side of the 2nd floor. If you go to the 1st floor, you’ll find Lawson and Family Mart a few steps away. 4. The hotel is close but not too close to the action. Plus, you can take side streets to avoid the mayhem of Shibuya Crossing and still get to all the amazing restaurant and bars.5. There is a washer and dryer on the 11th floor. Be prepared to spend at least an hour waiting for your clothes to dry. Be sure to clean the lint trap. There are many other places to stay in Shibuya so we would probably not stay there again because of the bad service. It’s a shame because I really love the location.
user_name:
SEINYC
New York City, New York

review_body: I booked the wrong hotel. Wanted to book Shibuya excel which I had stayed before. It’s convenient, right above the train station and also where the airport limousine bus stops.It’s my fault that I didn’t see carefully but this is a reminder to all to watch out. Shibuya Excel Stream is not the same hotel. Stayed 20-25 Nov.Pros:- new and tastefully designed- still relatively near the station (a 5-10 min walk)- room is spacious and clean-7-11 is just below the hotelCons:- I was travelling w old folks so the extra ten min from the train station made a difference to me-while concierge is generally polite, there is this older guy who does the late shift who’s less helpful and often stern

I am a frequent traveler to Tokyo. This is my 1st stay at the Shibuya Stream Excel Hotel. The hotel’s location is perfect, just about 3-min of walking distance between the New South Gate of JR Shibuya Station and the Hotel. For a traveler like me, I would say this boosts the rating of the hotel. When I walked out from the Narita Express train, followed the direction from taking the New South Exit, then Bingo - I could see the hotel on my left within just 50 meters away. I also find the staff are very helpful, and most of them speak good English. I will certainly come back and stay at the Shibuya Stream Excel Hotel.

Let me write a review as a frequent Shibuya visitor.I have been to Tokyo many times and for the past 10 years I have stayed in Mark City Excel Tokyu Hotel and I love it for its extreme convenience - I'm not talking about "easy access to trains", but about literally taking only 2 minutes - from the moment you step out your room door to step onto an actual train!! So I couldn't help but compare both hotels in terms of convenience.So Shibuya Stream opened and we decided to give it a try although we knew it was a bit far away. It is located at south of Shibuya station right next to Futoshin line. On google map it says about 250m walk from hotel to Shibuya station, yes it's close but you will need to go up and down bridge with stairs. In real life, there is a building (which is still being built) and a road in between Stream and station. The bridge linking the building and stream is not yet opened so you now have to walk among or around the construction site - which consists of turns and corners making the route longer. It was manageable but when you have to walk to the center of Shibuya eg Donki or 109 then it's gonna take 7-10 minutes. As for the hotel itself, room was nice with a retro 60s vibe. Somebody complained about storage and the sink in room. I had no problem with all that. Separating sink, toilet, and bathroom all made sense to us as we need not fight for using each of of those. Bed was comfy, bathroom was spacious, complimentary mineral water was offered. Room had no cold air-conditioning in November (hottest 20 degrees celsius outside) which was not to my liking but expected for a mid-price hotel in Japan. Service was beyond great, everyone speaks good English and was extremely helpful. We hadn't opt for breakfast so couldn't review the food. There was an interesting robot that looks like R2D2 that brings you stuff. We haven't tried it but when you try ordering water / amenities then the robot will take elevators and come to your door all by itself.There is no airport limousine bus stopping at the hotel. If you wanna take/arrive by one then you will have to take Stream's free shuttle to go to Mark City Tokyu Excel. The journey takes 10 minutes but only 1-2 rounds per hour so you will most likely need to spend another 15-20 mins wait time before you get on the limousine bus after you arrive Mark City. Also there is no drop off area for hotel guests. We arrived with our rented car and we had to park the car (with no validation offered) in order to unload all the luggage for check in. The building complex is cool with a few restaurants in the mall downstairs. The river was renovated with streaming effect but the smell was not very pleasant. Conclusion : I think I will go back to Mark City Tokyu Excel given its location. It's a comparatively older (but still good with older bathrooms & bedding etc.) hotel and not as nice as Stream but I was able to get to restaurants, shopping, or stations in less than 3 minutes. Price is also comparable between the two. Stream is nice but no limousine bus is a deal breaker as we always have many many suitcases and travelling with them on shuttles is just too much hassle. Also the relatively longer journey to center Shibuya can be quite tiring. Maybe the inconvenience can be improved after the in between building is finished in 2019 where you can walk a straight route to station (instead of turns and corners in a construction site right now).

My husband and I stayed for 8 nights and it was a great stay. We had a standard double on the 9th floor. The bed was so comfortable! The bedding, the bath towels, and the soap and shampoo were all really nice. Some other reviewers mentioned that there's no space to put clothes, and there is no dresser, but there is a clothes rack with some shelves to put things underneath and we were able to find places to put all our things.The first few floors of the building have a lot of restaurants, which is nice to have the option to get coffee or something to eat without going far. The location is obviously really convenient to Shibuya station, and also really easy to walk to Harajuku and Daikanyama etc.The breakfast at the hotel is really good, you get a choice of entree (french toast or eggs benedict) and there's a selection of pastries, cheese, salad, yogurt, fresh fruit, cold cuts, cereal, rice croquettes, and juices and coffee. It's the same every day though, and since we stayed for 8 nights we only ate there a few times.Tips:From Shibuya station, use the Hachiko exit, go right and keep going right to go past the busses, and then you can go up the stairs to cross over the street and you'll see the hotel/Stream building plaza. The first day, we took the New South Exit which is close to the hotel, but you have to walk a really long ways through the station to get to the exit (unless you're on a train that's closer to it, but you'll likely be closer to Hachiko).To get to the airport, there's a bus that leaves from the Excel Hotel, and there's a free shuttle from the Steam to the Excel. It's really convenient and easy when you have luggage, instead of taking the trains.They give you a free cell phone to use with unlimited data/internet. I might not have rented a pocket wifi if I would have known about that.

Great location, less than 5 mins walk from Shibuya Station with lots of great cafes and eating options within the first few floors of the building itself. Chic, stylish, well laid out rooms with many small thoughtful touches all around.

Great location, after you find it the first time. Brand New Hotel. Convenient when taking Narita Express Train. Take NEW South Gate Exit at Shibuya. When you get down the escalator, make a left and the hotel is up the street to your right. There are escalators that will lead you to the restaurant level of the building. Take the elevators towards the middle of the building to the 4th floor where you will find the lobby. If you get off at the Shibuya Station, easiest way would be to get out at the Hachiko exit, make your way towards the bus station pick up/drop off area and you can find some signs to lead you to the hotel. A lot of construction on going. Room size was good enough for me, my wife and 8 year old son. In Shibuya (let alone Tokyo), you're not really going to be hanging out in the room all day. We opted for the room and breakfast deal. Breakfast was limited to French Toast with a slice of Bacon or Eggs Benedict, there is also a small buffet with croissant, bread, salad, cereal and a few other choices. You can always get breakfast at many of the restaurants down stairs (some looked fairly pricey) or the surrounding area. 7-11, Lawson's, McDonald's is close by as well. Starbucks was not open downstairs yet. Try Luke's Lobster's, lobster roll and clam chowder for Lunch or Dinner, it's delicious. It's a short walk to the famous Hachiko statue and crossing. Police and Fire Station are across the street. At times, you will hear the sirens. Wasn't too big of a deal for us though. Great location to be in all the action of Shibuya. I would stay here again, less purchasing the breakfast option.

We had heard rooms in Japan are quite small and were surprised to find the room was a good size for two people. Very chic hotel in a great central area of Tokyo. Kind of difficult to find at first as you have to take an elevator to the lobby. The elevators are in a very nice indoor/outdoor street with a bunch of nice restaurants. Highly recommend for Tokyo

Property accessible via Shibuya station and walking distance to Shibuya crossing, Hachico and several malls. Breakfast was nice and will make you full. Not so much selection from the buffet but you get to choose a main meal. The deluxe room looks big in the pictures but felt a little bit cramped. Sink is outside the bathroom so it’s a bit weird for us. But the design and aesthetics were instagram worthy. Good use of space would be the perfect description. There are also lots of restaurants with food choice at the 2nd floor. Main lobby at the 4th flr was really huge too and beautifully designed.

Great front office service, friendly staffs, good food...Located near to sight seeing spots and shibuya station. Just minutes walk to hachico, don quijote, and shibuya cross. Easy to access from haneda airport...

This cannot be a competitive choice for travelers without a concierge desk. Many of the top restaurants in Tokyo require advance reservations. Some restaurants require that the reservations are made by your hotel.

Perfectly located in the new Shibuya Stream complex, the Shibuya Stream Excel Hotel Tokyu is a great place to stay. The rooms are comfortable and the hotel is immaculate. We stayed here for 10 days and found the location incredibly convenient. It is walking distant to the Shibuya Crossing, and has a huge range of restaurants within the complex, meaning you don’t have to go too far to get a great meal. The subway and JR line are both easily accessible. Yes, the rooms are on the smaller size but they’re actually quite large by Japan’s standards. The only issue we had (which I’m sure will be rectified with time) was finding the hotel on our first day. As it’s brand new, there isn’t too much signage for it and Google Maps will try to take you to the other Excel Tokyu hotels in Shibuya. Our advice: if you are taking the JR line, exit via the Hachiko Gate towards the bus terminal. From there, it’s fairly easy to find & there is some signage.

Love this hotel ! Perfect location, great design of the room and the front desk staffs are friendly ( especially the Indian girl, she speak perfect English and she is so sweet and patient)and well trained! Many nice restaurants in downstairs is a big plus for travelers!

Checked in at Shibuya Stream Excel today. It was about 10 minutes walk away from Shibuya Station. This place is awesome as it’s close to all the major tourist attraction like the famous Shibuya crossing and Harajuku (20 minutes walk or a ride away).It’s a very modern and stylish hotel. Think of warehouse kind of interior, concrete floor and brick walls. Very friendly and helpful staff. Check in was smooth.If you ask kindly, you’ll be able to checkout at 12 noon instead of the usual 11am.Each floor has a theme. There is even a shared kitchen area where you can cook rice and heat up store bought food in the microwave and oven. Too awesome for travellers who would like to save up some money.Loving the interior of the room we are staying. Its furnished with leather lounge chair and chevron carpeting. It’s at the top 13th floor with the view of the river. It’s light up pretty at night. We can see Tokyo Tower from here too. What a view, at night!My favourite thing about Shibuya Stream is it’s location. I could walk to Harajuku without having to catch the metro (which can get super jampacked at peak hour). Very happy to just hang out in the area. NOTE: 1. Don’t get mixed up with their other vote called Shibuya Excel Hotel. However, if you do end up at the other hotel, they provide a free shuttle bus service :)2. Enquire about the free shuttle bus service.3. They had bus limousines to Tokyo Haneda and Narita airport. You’ll need to either purchase tickets from the bus driver or buy it early. Please do enquire at the desk :)4. There is a scale at the counter for you to weight your luggages. Just in case, if you ended up shopping waaaay too much :)Thank you for a wonderful stay again. Such a cool kind of hotel. I’m happy I got to check this place out before heading back to Sydney.You can find me on Instagram for more travel images. I love exploring new places whenever I can.Instagram @hellomissmayHope you’re having fun in Shibuya as much as I do! It’s a safe place to wonder around, explore, eat and shop.XMay
